column4: Hi there! I'm trying to install hardy (ubuntu 32 or 64 or ubuntustudio), but the cd freeze in a Busybox (initramfs) screen!! ... I'd try almost all solutions I found on web, acpi=off, floppy=off, all_generic_ide, enable floppy support on bios, etc ... none help me! I have an Asus AV8-MX. Please, did someone had the same problem? Or knows how to help me?

noapic acpi=off, pci=irqroute, xmodule=vesa, vga=normal, vga=771, vga=791, pci=irqroute, framebuffer=false, ide=nodma, nomce, pnpbios=off, xdrvr=vesa, res=800x600, apm=off,pci=noapci, nolapic, all_generic_ide, nolapic, pci=assign-busses, pci=irqpoll, pci=biosirq, pnpbios=off, hpet=disable
At start or install press F6 and remove Quiet and Splash from the command line. If it still fails.. Repeat and after removing quiet and splash add noapic acpi=off before the "--"
If that fails you will need to try the alternate cd installer
I tried alternate too... :(
the cd works fine in the other computer! Not in the mainly one ...
What motherboard? Some need the bios set to ide compatibility mode
is an Asus A8V-MX (rubbish)
See if you have a bios option
well .. I'd see there one thing: in the hard drivers information there is 4 more IDE HD (satas), but I dont remember if I saw a place to configure that ...
look hard, I am alomst sure there is
other thing is the sata was disable when I'd install hardy (I had a lot problems with initramfs)
ok .. I will ... back in a minute ...
that is my bios: http://img529.imageshack.us/img529/1602/dscn4025sp7.jpg  ...  http://img529.imageshack.us/img529/3581/dscn4026jg7.jpg ...  http://img529.imageshack.us/img529/9955/dscn4028gc2.jpg
there is no other place showing about sata ...
I dont have an answer for that
looks like the bios set it automaticaly
well, I'm doing the update right now ... there is a initramfs-tool package on that update ... I hope that fix my problem!! :/
someone told me to try to capture on sata HD (and that is why I changed from usb), but I think it will not makes it better ... I mean, I really don't know!!
what is AHCI ?  (on bios sata option)
advanced host controller iterface..
